{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3524983,"name":"James","username":"JamerGamer789","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/e19b73/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-12T17:18:15.598Z","cooked":"

Our team is relatively new to swerve and path planning. When we set the robot up, we want it to face toward the reef, which is not facing downfield when we exit auto. We want to be able to quickly transition from auto to teleop with out. How do we compensate for this?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-02-12T17:18:15.598Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":25,"reads":56,"readers_count":55,"score":136.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":491376,"topic_slug":"yagsl-gyro-offset-for-auto","display_username":"James","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51278,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/yagsl-gyro-offset-for-auto/491376/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3525001,"name":"","username":"nstrike","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nstrike/{size}/167038_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-12T17:25:00.004Z","cooked":"

The third parameter in the example is the starting Pose2d which we can give an explicit example.

github.com

BroncBotz3481/YAGSL-Example/blob/main/src/main/java/frc/robot/subsystems/swervedrive/SwerveSubsystem.java#L90-L93


      
    
          
  1. swerveDrive = new SwerveParser(directory).createSwerveDrive(Constants.MAX_SPEED,
    2. 
          
  2.                                                             new Pose2d(new Translation2d(Meter.of(1),
    3. 
          
  3.                                                                                          Meter.of(4)),
    4. 
          
  4.                                                                        Rotation2d.fromDegrees(0)));
    5.

As for transitioning you wouldn’t have this problem if you controlled the swerve drive by angular velocity instead of direct angles. Bc you control it by direct angles you have to add an offset somehow. I can add a helper function for this but i currently do not have one bc it is jot that big of a deal

Wouldn’t we have translation issues? The swerve faces towards my team’s alliance wall rather than downfield. After auto when we push forward on the stick it would drive towards the alliance wall. Our team in the past has turned the robot on and then rotated it after the gyro initialized, but this cause other problems and we would get a look from the refs for taking too long.

If you’re asking about alliance relative controls we have that

broncbotz3481.github.io

SwerveInputStream (Yet Another Generic Swerve Library API)

declaration: package: swervelib, class: SwerveInputStream
